title: Michael Jordan's 23XI Racing Goes All-In With Nicotine Twist for 2025 NASCAR Expansion
text:
So far in the 2025 NASCAR season, along with navigating complex legal landscapes,
Michael Jordanâ€™s 23XI Racing team is also making headlines for securing notable sponsorships.
Recently, 23XI Racing revealed the new look for their No. 35 car driven by Riley Herbst. In a post on X, they said, â€œJust smile and wave. The No. 35 LUCY Breakers Toyota Camry XSE will hit the track for the first time in Martinsville.â€ The post also included an image of the carâ€™s new paint scheme with the LUCY Breakers logo. As per the post, the new look for the No.35 car will have its on-track debut for the first time at the Martinsville speedway.
NASCAR Fans Share Their Thoughts on the New Look
As of November 2024, 23XI Racing announced the expansion to a third full-time NASCAR Cup Series car, the No. 35 Toyota Camry XSE, driven by Herbst and primarily sponsored by Monster Energy. With the new announcement, NASCAR fans can expect to see the No. 35 car debut its new look by the end of March.
Just smile and wave ðŸ‘‹
The No. 35 LUCY Breakers Toyota Camry XSE will be hitting the track for the first time in Martinsville.

Reacting to the post, one fan said, â€œGood lookinâ€™ ride there, and harkens back to the old Copenhagen/Skoal days with tobacco cars.â€
Another fan chipped in, â€œNice paint scheme.â€
â€œGood looking scheme!â€ added another fan.
23XI Racing Expanded to Third Full-Time Car
In 2024, 23XI Racing announced the addition of a third NASCAR Cup Series car. Herbst, 25, will pilot the No. 35 Toyota, joining the team alongside Tyler Reddick and Bubba Wallace in the third car as 23XI expands operations.
Herbst said, â€œItâ€™s an honor to join 23XI and Toyota for the opportunity to race in the Cup Series each week. Racing full-time in the Cup Series has been my goal since I started in NASCAR, and Iâ€™m excited to start my Cup career with such an accomplished and driven team.â€
â€œWhat 23XI has accomplished in a short time is impressive, and I look forward to building on their success as the organization grows. Itâ€™s also great to continue representing Monster, and Iâ€™m excited about adding to their legacy in NASCAR.â€
So far, Monster Energy, a longtime partner with Herbst, has been the primary sponsor of the No. 35 Toyota Camry. However, with 23XI Racingâ€™s latest announcement on X, fans can expect to see the new paint scheme and sponsorship announced soon.
Before 23XI Racing, Herbst made eight Cup Series starts with Rick Ware Racing and Front Row Motorsports. In the fall of 2023, he scored a career-high ninth-place result at the Talladega Superspeedway.
